meanings.definition: To swing by the arms from one hold to another.
meanings.sent1: Monkeys brachiate effortlessly through the trees.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast decided to brachiate across the monkey bars.
meanings.sent3: The circus performer tried to brachiate on the hanging rings but ended up spinning comically.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts brachiate from one worry to the next, never finding peace.
meanings.sent5: The vines in the jungle seemed to brachiate with a life of their own, reaching out to grab anything in their path.

meanings.sent1: The brachiate creature moved gracefully through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The robot had brachiate arms that could reach high shelves easily.
meanings.sent3: The inflatable tube man at the car dealership looked oddly brachiate with its waving arms.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches intertwined in a brachiate dance against the evening sky.
meanings.sent5: The octopus displayed its brachiate tentacles, exploring every nook and cranny of its tank.
